description:
Verify and Configure Pino Logger Installation

Check if Pino logger is already installed in the project, and if not, install and configure it with production-ready features including environment-specific settings, sensitive data redaction, and log aggregation capabilities.

Requirements:
- Check package.json for existing Pino installation and version
- Install Pino and necessary plugins if not present (pino, pino-pretty for development)
- Create logger configuration module with environment-specific settings (development, staging, production)
- Implement PHI/PII redaction rules to prevent sensitive data leakage (e.g., passwords, SSNs, credit cards, health information)
- Configure appropriate log levels per environment (debug for dev, info/warn for production)
- Set up log formatting (JSON in production, pretty-print in development)
- Configure log aggregation transport (e.g., pino-syslog, pino-cloudwatch, or file-based rotation)
- Add TypeScript types if applicable
- Create basic usage examples for common logging scenarios
- Document which fields are automatically redacted

Edge Cases to Consider:
- Handling nested objects that may contain sensitive data
- Circular references in logged objects
- Performance impact of redaction in high-throughput scenarios
- Log rotation and storage limits for file-based logging
title: Install or verify Pino logger with environment configs
